attributes.action: Tourist visa free access UK for citizens of the republic of Albania.
attributes.background: Since 2010 the citizens of the Albania were granted a Visa-free to the Schengen are countries. We think that the United Kingdom needs to follow the example set from the EU and to allow the Albanians citizens a visa-free entry for tourism purpose in the UK

attributes.action: Restrict the number of hounds used for trail hunting to two.
attributes.background: The hunting act of 2004 is being abused in the guise of drag hunting, I therefore suggest that the maximum number of hounds used in a drag/trail hunt would be two, as it only takes one dog to follow a trail.

attributes.action: Add medical examinations and re-testing of Drivers over the age of retirement
attributes.background: Unfortunately there is little legislation to ensure the capability and medical standard needed to drive safely is always maintained. People pass their test and later slip into bad habits or develop health implications that prove a risk to others.

attributes.action: To prohibit the sale of rat poison to non-professionals
attributes.background: People are baiting dog treats and or leaving large quantities of it in parks and open spaces to kill off animals. I have had one dog recently die and another even more recently digest a large quantity and is lucky to be alive. Luckily we rushed him straight to the vets and he is now home safe.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.theargus.co.uk/news/16860293.family-devastated-as-rat-poison-kills-one-dog-and-almost-kills-another/

attributes.action: Introduce a minimum required level of qualification for music teachers.
attributes.background: There is currently no minimum standard legally required of music teachers.This means that you could end up taking lessons from someone at, say, grade 2 standard who hasn't the faintest idea about musical techniques, let alone teaching ones; the impact on your musical endeavours would be devastating.
attributes.additional_details:
Arguments in favour include that this would:
-Raise the standard of music teaching and musicianship in the UK, ensuring a minimum level of competence.
-Prevent people from wasting their hard-earned money on low-quality services.
-Stop unqualified teachers who charge baseline rates from putting qualified teachers out of business. 
-Solve an equity issue, as there are minimum qualification requirements for academic subject teachers.
-Allow for more equal opportunities, as teachers of socially or economically disadvantaged children would be more able to spot and nurture talent.
-Attract more talented individuals to the profession.

I would suggest a minimum requirement for music teachers of grade 8 or equivalent on their instrument(s) and a qualification in teaching.

attributes.action: Ensure MPs can scrutinise, amend and vote on any final Brexit deal
attributes.background: The British people voted in the referendum on our membership of the EU and our politicians must organise a coordinated withdrawal in the best interest of the nation. Our democratically elected representatives must not be stripped of the power to analyse and amend any deal before passing it into law.
attributes.additional_details: The future of our nation will be affected profoundly by leaving the EU. Our representatives in Parliament must be able to have a meaningful say and make binding amendments on the terms of the final Brexit proposals made by Government negotiators. To not do so undermines our democracy and silences parliament. A rushed ill considered “take it or leave it” vote would adversely affect our nation for generations.

attributes.action: Reciprocate the Spanish Decree protecting citizen´s rights post Brexit.
attributes.background: Spain have moved to create a royal decree which protects thousands of Briton´s lives in Spain in the event of a no-deal Brexit. It covers rights to social security, healthcare and education amongst others. Once passed into Spanish Law this will depend on reciprocation to be implemented.
attributes.additional_details: The UK government should act now to secure the lives of thousands both in Spain and in the UK. This will lead the way for other European countries to secure rights for those who currently exercise their right to live abroad in the European Union. With Brexit fast approaching, offering stability and reassurance to people´s lives is vital.

attributes.action: All ‘fox’ hunts to be filmed by 3rd party, to ensure compliance with Hunting Act
attributes.background: Hunting of wild animals using dogs was made illegal in 2004, yet many continue to do it. Alternative hunts have been created in which dogs follow pre-placed scents, however many still attack wild animals. We believe the following further measures need to be taken:
attributes.additional_details:
- Dogs taking part in the hunt should be muzzled. They are only animals and do not know they should be following the pre-placed scent. It is the owners’ responsibility to ensure wild animals aren’t harmed.
- Hunts should be filmed. The whole hunt should be filmed, paid for by the organised hunt group, and the footage reviewed by a third party to make sure it is compliant with 2004 Hunting Act. Any illegal activity should be passed over to the police for prosecution.

attributes.action: To Make it Mandatory for cinemas to show at least 4 films a week subtitled.
attributes.background: I am a 13 year old boy who is hearing impaired, and fed up with not being able to watch movies like my friends can. I miss out on so many movies. The cinemas only show at best one a week and they are usually at very inconvenient times. Why can’t there be 4 subtitled showings of every movie a week?
attributes.additional_details: I have checked at multiple cinemas, and they have said that you can request for a film to be shown subtitled, however there are no guarantees they will and also they require several weeks notice with no flexibility on times or days, which means I am usually left with their day and time schedule or nothing, which is more often the case. I feel very strongly that this is unfairly discriminating people with a hearing impairment. Given that, most movies are shown around 5 to 10 times a day for 2 or 3 weeks, resulting in at least 105 showings of each film. I don’t feel that it’s too much too ask to have 4 subtitled showings a week.

attributes.action: Allow cannabis oil to be prescribed for terminally ill cancer patients
attributes.background: The UK has recently approved medical cannabis oil on the NHS but not for terminal cancer patients. All terminal cancer suffers should be able to receive cannabis oil. Please sign this petition and let's give these suffers hope of a more fulfilled life.

attributes.action: Require shops to give workers Boxing Day, New Year’s Day and Easter Sunday off.
attributes.background: It’s so unfair. Whilst area managers, company owners and office staff stay home with their families retail workers HAVE to work! We need time at home with our families too. Where I live there is no public transport on Boxing Day so I’m expected to walk the 4 miles to work and back!!

attributes.action: Allow European Nationals to vote in UK general elections
attributes.background:
European Nationals are contributing in  all parts of the British society and are currently  not allowed to vote in general elections ,when citizens of the commonwealth are allowed , help us end this unfair practice.
Give them a voice, give them a chance to vote
attributes.additional_details:
European Nationals are your neighbours, your friends, your husbands and wives, many have settled in the UK and are making a real contribution to your daily lives, they serve you in your local cafe, they are your doctors and Nurses .
They love the UK and pay their taxes here, but are currently not allowed to vote in the general elections, we want to ask the UK government to end this unfair practice and allow them to vote in the general elections.

attributes.action: A 2nd Brexit referendum should allow 17 year olds on electoral registers to vote
attributes.background: Brexit will affect the UK for generations to come, and in particular the future of our young people.  As with the referendum on Scottish Independence, it is only right therefore that more of them should be given a say.
attributes.additional_details: Ideally such a vote should be extended to all eligible 16 and 17 year olds in the UK, but I recognise that there is unlikely to be enough time to enact this before a second Brexit Referendum, if there is one.  However, electoral rolls should already include the names of 17 year old household occupants.

attributes.action: Urge USA not to cease funding UNWRA and contribute towards any shortfall
attributes.background:
The US decision further destabilises the Middle East and make the possibility of a peaceful solution more remote. It shows further partiality in favour of Israel following  moving its embassy to Jerusalem and increasing aid to Israel

UK should urge other countries to help making up the shortfall
attributes.additional_details:
UNWRA provides food aid and education to Palestinian refugees and this loss of funding will cause immense suffering and misery.
https://www.unrwa.org
https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-us-canada-45377336

attributes.action: Give British Territory Parliamentary Representation
attributes.background:
British citizenship should mean access to true representation.
We have overseas territory with British populations, we must provide these populations the choice to become an incorporated British territory with parliamentary representation.
Through a referendum they should be given this choice.
attributes.additional_details:
British Oversea's Territories consist of 14 separate entities.
Many of the territories have voted in fair democratic elections to remain British islands, these include but are not limited to:

"Gibraltar sovereignty referendum of 2002" 98.97%
(https://bit.ly/2M3I84N)
"Falkland Islands sovereignty referendum of 2013" 99.8% 
(https://bit.ly/2H7LQvx)
"Bermuda sovereignty referendum of 1995" 74.12%
(https://bit.ly/2D1utIA)

Our new incorporated stance could potentially end international disputes.

attributes.action: Introduce prostrate screening for men from 55 years of age.
attributes.background: I know a small group of guys where 6 people have been diagnosed with prostrate cancer, sadly one of these recently passed away. Earlier screening could have prevented this death.
attributes.additional_details: Prostrate cancer in men is growing as reported in many media reports. Woman get screened for Breast cancer and with the increase in prostrate cancer earlier screening can save lives and reduce NHS costs.

attributes.action: Set maximum waiting time of one hour for transport home from NHS A&E.
attributes.background: At 1.30pm on Monday 11th February 2019 my wife suffered a choking incident at home which required emergency treatment at our local A&E. Discharged at 5pm and didn't get home until after midnight. A&E staff stated it was common for patients to wait more than three hours for transport home.
attributes.additional_details: My wife was receiving palliative care for incurable cancer and needed her medication. The wait resulted in already overstretched A&E staff having to find the correct medication for her.

attributes.action: Raise the age of sale, of fireworks, to the general public from 18 to 25.
attributes.background: All year round this is an issue but it becomes more apparent in the winter months. Irresponsible youths are allowed to purchase fireworks and they have no regard for the safety of others. Fireworks are meant to be fun but in the wrong hands they soon become weapons.
attributes.additional_details: I have already read so many public posts, by people who have already been affected by youths setting off fireworks in public places, about people whose pets suffer huge distress, let alone non domestic wildlife. If fireworks must be sold to the public it needs to be regulated better.

attributes.action: Stop Councils charging disabled people for the cost of care and support at home
attributes.background: I am 23 years old. I have profound Learning Difficulties with complex health needs. Currently, I live at home with my mum and dad who provide a roof over my head, saving the government a huge amount of money.
attributes.additional_details: The councils are using the term Fairer Contribution Financial Assessment for Social Care to charge disabled people extra money to balance their books. This is an indirect cut to my benefits as well as to my care package. The main principles of the Care Act are well- being, these charges are going to impact on health.

attributes.action: Have a referendum to devolve Yorkshire into a country.
attributes.background: As a student in the heart of Yorkshire, I believe it is the fundamental right for citizens of Yorkshire to have greater power over their society, economy and environment.
attributes.additional_details: This is why I am proposing to start a referendum to decide whether the people of Yorkshire want to be independent from England but remain in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Ban non recyclable plastic food pouches used for some pet foods, baby foods, etc
attributes.background: Plastic pouches are classified as laminated plastic & are not recyclable so they are arguably even worse for the environment than plastic bottles as there is no option but to put them into landfill.  There are many other packaging alternatives for the products using pouches, they should be banned.

attributes.action: Stop taxing the state pension, the elderly already paid their tax while working
attributes.background: It is wrong for our elderly to be further taxed on their pensions when they have already paid enough tax throughout their working lives.
attributes.additional_details: The old age pension should not be taxed you taxed us already.

attributes.action: ‘Palm oil’ to be clearly labelled on products containing it, to help consumers.
attributes.background: There are many names for palm oil that consumers won’t recognise. It is not as clear as looking at the ingredients list on a product and searching for palm oil. Some ingredients may be from palm oil but it will not be labelled, e.g. ‘vegetable oil’ in a product may or may not be from palm oil.
attributes.additional_details:
Some names for ingredients that could or do contain palm oil:
INGREDIENTS: Vegetable Oil, Vegetable Fat, Palm Kernel, Palm Kernel Oil, Palm Fruit Oil, Palmate, Palmitate, Palmolein, Glyceryl, Stearate, Stearic Acid, Elaeis Guineensis, Palmitic Acid, Palm Stearine, Palmitoyl Oxostearamide, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide-3, Sodium Laureth Sulfate, Sodium Lauryl Sulfate, Sodium Kernelate, Sodium Palm Kernelate, Sodium Lauryl Lactylate/Sulphate, Hyrated Palm Glycerides, Etyl Palmitate, Octyl Palmitate, Palmityl Alcohol

CONTAINS: Palm oil

attributes.action: Include teaching ‘self examination’ in health/sex education in schools.
attributes.background: Having been diagnosed with breast cancer ive learnt that early detection really does save lives.How many truly check and know their bodies?In school we are taught sex ed/hygiene. Teaching to routinely self examine the correct way in this lesson would bring body awareness and in turn early detection
attributes.additional_details: My intention with this petition is that if self examination is introduced to the health/sex Education curriculum then self checking would become part of our daily lives and routines like washing/cleaning teeth/wearing deodorant. ..whilst in the shower we check ourselves. Right now we don’t all do it because we weren’t taught too from a young age and it’s not routine. This needs to change and be taught in schools, early detection does save lives it is so important to know your body!

attributes.action: All U.K nightclub doorways to have knife and gun detection arches by law.
attributes.background: We have a major Knife crime problem in our UK cities right now. We want to make knife and gun detection arches compulsory by law at all night clubs controlled by security Industry Authority door supervisors, with stop and search rights on all that enter private and public drinking venues.
attributes.additional_details: Many knife incidents occur in nightclubs, we as members of the public need more protection. The government along with the security Industry Authority (SIA) must apply a new law with the license holders of all night clubs in the UK that will see knife and gun detection arches become compulsory.

attributes.action: Ban Unpaid Internships
attributes.background: Unpaid and voluntary internships of all lengths must be made illegal. They are exploitative & harm social mobility. Despite the Government's recent efforts, they are still common. It must be made easier for interns to understand their rights, and to report organisations that offer unpaid work.
attributes.additional_details:
It has been estimated that an unpaid internship last one month in London will cost the intern over £1000. 

More information and research into unpaid internships can be found on the Sutton Trust for social mobility website: 
https://www.suttontrust.com/about-us/us/social-mobility/

For more information on your rights as an intern, visit:
https://www.gov.uk/employment-rights-for-interns

attributes.action: Update the child benefit rate annually at least in line with inflation.
attributes.background: The costs of living have been constantly going up. Purchasing power decreased by 3.21% in 2018. However, the current child benefit rate which is £20.70 per week is not only very low but it has not been updated for several years now.
attributes.additional_details: In 2009/2010 the child benefit rate was £20 per week. Now, the rate is £20.70. Please make a comparison of what could be purchased for £20 10 years ago and what can be purchased now for roughly the same amount.

attributes.action: Stop the plans to add folic acid to flour because of allergies
attributes.background: News that folic acid is to be added to flour could be bad news for the future health of children. Folic acid during pregnancy has been linked to food allergies in later childhood. Increased allergies increase the burden on NHS. Some allergies are potentially fatal.
attributes.additional_details:
Recent medical research https://www.medpagetoday.com/meetingcoverage/aaaai/71566
 
https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5949539/
 
http://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/POST-PN-467/POST-PN-467.pdf
 
Increasing allergies 
https://www.allergyuk.org/information-and-advice/statistics
 
Increasing food allergies in children and death 
https://amp.theguardian.com/society/2018/oct/01/why-are-food-allergies-in-children-on-the-rise-and-is-there-anything-parents-can-do-to-protect-them

attributes.action: Introduce a law banning retailers charging less for plastic-wrapped multipacks
attributes.background: Many supermarkets offer discount for multipack products, but often these are wrapped in single-use plastic. I believe consumers shouldn't be incentivised to buy unnecessary plastic, when exactly the same amount of product can be bought without plastic holding it together.
attributes.additional_details: The kind of plastic used to hold food and drinks cans/cartons together takes many years to degrade and can break down into microplastics, which have a particularly devastating impact on our oceans. We've already seen the benefits of charging consumers 5p for shopping bags: single-use plastic bag sales have fallen dramatically. I believe consumers should also pay for the kind of plastic that holds multipacks together by making it illegal for supermarkets to charge less for them.

attributes.action:
Celebrate Brexit!
Fly the Union Flag on every Government Building on March 29
attributes.background:
As a sign of our great country regaining her sovereignty and independence, the Union Flag should be flown on every Government building on March 29.
This is an historic day for our country.
Let's celebrate our very own Independence Day every year by flying our Union Flag with pride.

attributes.action: Make LGBT+ Sex Ed. Compulsory In Secondary Schools.
attributes.background: Secondary schools often completely gloss over or fail to teach LGBT+ sexual education, leaving these students to feel isolated, unaccepted and unprepared. This can have a bad effect on both the mental and physical health of LGBT+ teens.
attributes.additional_details:
Just one in six LGBT+ young people have been taught about healthy same-sex relationships, and they are at a higher risk for substance abuse, STDs, bullying, anxiety and depression. Trans teens aren't properly taught on how to bind safety, leaving them at risk of permanent injury. 

(Sources: The CDC and Stonewall)

attributes.action: Call for a total ban on plastic "tagging barbs" & "tag fasteners" from Clothing
attributes.background: Single-use plastics may represent the epitome of today’s throwaway culture. The U.N. Environment reports just nine per cent of the world’s nine billion tonnes of plastic has been recycled and the clothing industry as one of the worst offenders.

attributes.action: Hold a second EU membership referendum, including votes at 16
attributes.background: Around 1.5 million people aged 16 or 17 were excluded from voting in a referendum which is going to greatly impact their future. It's undemocratic for the government to completely ignore the opinion of these very capable people - we should have a say!
attributes.additional_details: For the Scottish independence referendum, the franchise was extended to include votes at 16 as the Scottish parliament understood how much it's going to affect their future. We young people will eventually be working for ourselves and providing for ourselves, but all this could be without the many benefits from the European Union - which you all enjoy today - and we didn't even get a chance to have a say.

attributes.action: Release IPP prisoners whose sentence exceeds current sentence guidelines
attributes.background: There are many people still serving an ipp sentence (imprisonment for public protection.) Although the law changed in 2012 to get rid of this sentence as this was classed as inhumane. Many people are still serving this sentence. My partner is currently 1 of 3000 people who are on this sentence.
attributes.additional_details:
These people are serving their time but why should these prisoners have to serve something that was abolished? 
why should the prison system have one sentence for one and another for someone else who did the same crime but a few years later? 
I am proposing that parliament brings the ipp sentence inline with the sentence that was brought in to replace it. 
This will help address the over crowding.
 
In 2017 there were still 3,350 IPPs still in prison. 
http://ippfanilycampaign.blogspot.com/

attributes.action: Prevent government from including gagging clauses in contracts with charities.
attributes.background: The government has reportedly included clauses in their contracts with NGOs, charities and businesses, barring the organisations in question from creating 'adverse publicity'. This prevents organisations speaking up for the people they are trying to help. Sign the petition to have this debated.
attributes.additional_details:
This type of gagging clause has been reported to have been used with Brexit consultants, Grenfell Tower investigators and charities working with Universal Credit claimants, amongst others. 
 
The government is systematically silencing dissent, putting self interest above the welfare of its citizens. This, ultimately, represents a threat to democracy.
 
Sign the petition so this can be discussed in Parliament.

attributes.action: NHS screening for Lung cancer for people aged 55 and over.
attributes.background: My mother was diagnosed with stage 4 metastatic lung cancer in September 2018. Before her diagnosis she had no symptoms and was healthy. She died on October 6th 2018 after a short battle with the disease. She didn’t display Any symptoms until the cancer had speedy to her kidneys, liver and spine.
attributes.additional_details: Lung cancer is one of the biggest killers in the world. Never usually displaying symptoms untill it is too late. Regular 3-5 yearly screening in people who smoke or have a history of smoking or for people who have family history of Lung cancer or other health problems that higher the risk will hopefully lower the mortality rate and give people who develop this disease a fighting chance when it is at a stage where successfully treated.

attributes.action: Apply the rule of law to British Citizens who joined ISIS
attributes.background: British citizens who have been radicalised in our country should be dealt with here. We should not be palming our criminals / victims off to other states.
attributes.additional_details:
The Home Office 2018 counter-terrorism strategy outlines how to deal with a British woman who travels to join ISIS & has a baby. This should be applied consistently. Please see Tweet from the Secret Barrister. https://twitter.com/BarristerSecret/status/1098139734176686080 

For the rule of law to mean anything, it has to apply to all of us. Including those who would do us the most harm.

attributes.action: Ban Arthur Goldberg from the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: Arthur Goldberg wrote Light in the Closet: Torah, Homosexuality, and the Power to Change. He openly claimed homosexuality was a curable disease.
attributes.additional_details:
He was the Director of JONAH (Jews Offering New Alternatives to Homosexuality), which offered gay conversion therapy. It referred vulnerable young men in the USA, UK and around the world, struggling with their sexuality within the Jewish community to therapists for conversion.
 
JONAH was shut down by US courts but we believe he continues to operate conversion therapy organisations.

attributes.action: Stop pets being sold online.
attributes.background: This is becoming a huge issue, people buy pets sometimes with bad intentions or purely for breeding therefore aren't buying your pet as a 'pet' to love and care for. This is massively on the increase and unwanted pets should be rehomed through trusted places such as dogs trust rather than eBay etc.
attributes.additional_details: These websites don't specialise in pets or regulations in that industry therefore you never really know what you're getting yourself into selling your pet on these sites. Professional agencies trusted to rehome your pets should be used. dogs are being sold on hundreds of sites for extremely cheap prices with no questions asked by the seller to the buyer regarding whether the requirements will be met for housing needs, food and dietary requirements. We must keep pets safe.

attributes.action: Abolish School league Tables
attributes.background: School league tables prioritise limited targets they are a clumsy statistical tool at the root of a disintegrating education system. Disempowering teachers, and learners, compromising head teachers while hijacking and suffocating the joy of learning at the cruel expense of the learners education.
attributes.additional_details: On line response to a  Question time clip  has made it clear that there is a need for radical reform of Assessment methods to prioritise effective learner engagement. There needs to be a greater  range of assessment methods that  enable and guide the learner and  recognise the many different purposes and evidences of learning while respecting the teachers skills and expertise.This will provide many different outcomes, that will not fit into a one size fits all school league table.

attributes.action: Remove Arriva of their contract for disruptions to people and the economy
attributes.background:
Strip arriva rail north of the franchise as they are not giving customers 100%

We want to the government to strip arriva rail north of the franchise as the company are failing everywhere - trains delayed, they're getting rid of guards.

attributes.action: NHS & Social Care Services to adopt the Edith Ellen Foundation Kindness Charter.
attributes.background: As there is little evidence of improvements in addressing unsafe and poor care services, the Government should aim for one standardised quality of care everyone can trust by requiring the NHS and social care providers to adopt this charter.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.edithellenfoundation.org/the-kindness-charter/

attributes.action: Mandatory training on narcissism in law enforcement and social services
attributes.background: Training should be required for social services, police, courts, doctors and child psychologists, so people can understand what victims have been through and give the support needed.
attributes.additional_details: The mental health side effects can take a long time to heal, parents need help for themselves as the narcissist will still use manipulation on them and those around them to alienate them from support. The children need extra support networks, if they still visit the other parent, safeguarding issues need to be checked to see if the manipulation can be counteracted or children need no contact.

attributes.action: Change Dangerous Dog Act to exclude puppies from being detained under this act
attributes.background: A 4 month old puppy has been detained under the dangerous dog act after escaping from a garden onto a busy main road. Obviously scared and distressed, he hid under a stationary lorry.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst he was being retrieved, he unfortunately bit a police officer.
https://www.thekennelclub.org.uk/getting-a-dog-or-puppy/general-advice-about-caring-for-your-new-puppy-or-dog/toilet-training-for-puppies/puppy-training-biting-nipping/

Puppies are born in the litter, and they play with biting, it takes them a few month to learn about biting. 
A scared dogs normal reaction is to bite to self defend

attributes.action: Require all new houses to have solar panels and a rainwater collection facility.
attributes.background:
No attempts are being made to assist with water consumption or power generation when measures are available to lessen the burden on resources.
It is simply not sensible to flush a toilet with water of drinking water standard when rainwater can perform a similar job.
attributes.additional_details: Yes there will be an increase in cost if providing such facilities but with widespread use this will diminish as standard parts are manufactured and used.

attributes.action: Urge Japan to criminalise hunting, slaughter & sale of dolphins into captivity
attributes.background: In Taiji hunters drive pods of dolphins with banger/speed boats & nets into the cove for sale into captivity, slaughter or release. The drive is brutal, captivity of wild dolphins is cruel, slaughter in front of their family is devastating & release is heartbreaking for young who lost family members
attributes.additional_details: http://www.wowvstaiji.com/

attributes.action: Be commited to holding a second referendum on Scottish independence after Brexit
attributes.background: I am asking the UK government to be committed to holding a second referendum on Scottish Independence, because it looks like we are heading towards a hard Brexit, which could damaging to the UK and Scottish economies in the future.
attributes.additional_details:
And also here is a list of things she plans to and/or could do do to Scotland:

- take Scotland out of the EU against its will, despite voting overwhelmingly to remain. 
- remove powers from the Scottish Parliament after Brexit. 
- they could close down the parliament and rip up the devolution settlement. 
- wipe out the SNP and other parties completely for good in Scotland. 
- sell Scotland down the river.
The prime minister must regard this as a ‘power grab’ if this is likely to happen.

attributes.action: The British people should have a referendum on abolishing the Monarchy.
attributes.background: The British people should be given a referendum to decide whether to keep the Monarchy or become a republic.
attributes.additional_details: The British public should be given a vote to decide whether to keep the Monarchy or not.

attributes.action: Require Companies House to carry out background checks
attributes.background: The current system of no checks done needs to change and the new law needs be implemented. So please can we stop this loophole, make background checks on company directors and secretaries happen soon?
attributes.additional_details:
Made a phone call to Companies House and they told me that they do not do any checks on the companies that register with them. They also told me that they simply go on people's trust. 
A new law and background checks would make it more secure, safer and companies more accountable. The way it is now anyone could make up information because no checks are being done.

attributes.action: Mandatory training on self -harm for all those working with young people.
attributes.background: Training can be either online or from visiting experts booked in to deliver a training session. Our hope is that a greater understanding of self-harm will stop it being a taboo subject, which will result in sufferers asking for and getting the appropriate support they need.
attributes.additional_details: According to The Mental Health Foundation (2018) the UK has the highest self-harm rate of any country in Europe with estimates of 400 in 100,000 people self-harming. Additionally it is noted that the numbers may be higher due to people who do self-harm but do not tell anyone about it. Self-harm can affect anybody but according to NICE (2003) the majority of people who report self-harm are aged between 11 and 25.
